Mellows out to a smooth banana/yeast taste. A very interesting twist to this. I havent really had a witbier with that very sharp sour taste that disappears quickly. Smooth beer, but not one of my favorite witbiers, but still decent.

(bottle at Old Chicago in Lincoln, NE). Pours a cloudy, dark yellow color. Medium white head. Wheat aroma. Strong wheat and coriander flavor. Avg duration. Slightly astringent finish. Spare lacing. Slick texture. Moderate carbonation.

12 oz bottle. Might have been a month past its date, not sure, the date code was smeared, but I wouldnt be surprised coming from Total Wine. Anyhoo, poured a golden color, mildly hazy, foaming white head. Didnt really look like a witbier. Ive been moving toward an active dislike of the style for awhile now, and this one came just in time to remind me of what is good in these beers. Refreshing nose was big on coriander, with a little citrus and minty wheat, very little phenol, which I appreciate. Flavor was clean enough, with a touch of coriander and zesty wheat, hint of citrus. Clean slightly herbal finish.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy, pale yellow with small white head that fades to a thin rim.  Aroma is strongly coriander with some banana and belgian yeast aroma.  Flavor is citrus up front followed by lots of spice.  Finishes slightly tart and acidic.

12oz bottle. Pours like frothy urine with a small white head. Not a very appealing color to the pour. Aroma is of citrus, banana, malt, spice, and hops. Taste is of very spicy bananas and grassy hops. Has a nice spicy malt backbone with lots of corainder. Lots of lemon zest in the body. Mouthfeel is very acidic and malty. A very drinkable beer that is easy to sip on, if not just slightly too acidic.

Tap at the Ginger Man in NYC.  Nice slightly hazy yellow color with a white head.  Aroma of lemon, orange pale, coriander, and yeast.  Flavor is sweet malt, orange, lemon, and coriander/spice.  Body medium, dry on the finish.

Pours pale and with a minimal amount of haze, fizzy carb and a white head that lacks retention (could be the glass); nice lacing.  Pleasant aromas of sour lemon and a hint of wet hay.  Taste is all citrus up front, spicy hops and coriander in the middle, and bit of astringency, most likely from the spice, at the end.  Could use a bit more in the body.  Finishes dry.  A good wit, but I think its a bit one-dimensional for the style.
Bottle poured a cloudy yellow/gold with disappearing head.  Great lemon spice aroma and the taste was very citrusy.  Somewhat dry mouthfeel.  Refreshing, summer brew.
Pours a pale golden color with a thick white head. Aroma of yeast and coriander. Taste of citrus and spice.  Intresting brew. A little watery.

12 ounce bottle from Bruisin Ales. Pours a hazy orange color with a thin head. Aroma is very bready, yeasty and spicy. Overly spiced almost like a pumpkin ale. Taste is citrus, bread, caramel and spice. Medium bodied. Not too impressed with this one.

cloudy straw pour.  Orange spice and some sherbert, coriander, subtle spice.  Mouthfeel is fantastic, subtle smooth and creamy yet a little sharpness at the end from the carbonation.  nice spice and orange zest.  A very refreshing wit, with a suprising 6.8% abv which is very well hidden.

Location: Draft from RFDs, 5/23/09


Aroma: Citrus, wheat, yeast, orange, sugary

Appearance: Hazy whitish gold color that is typical of this style

Flavor: Sweet, light spice, similar to the nose

Palate: Light-Medium body, pretty light considering the ABV

Overall Impression: 
I thought this one was basically a better version (similar characteristics, just a done better) of a Hoegaarden.  I liked it, but didnt love it.

On Tap at Chappys in Dayton. I really dont like WItbier much, but this one wasnt bad.  It has a stronger flavor than others Ive tried of the same style.  But I just find most these fairly boring and too much like lemonade.  However, like most, this beer is very refreshing and easy to drink.  Some decent citrus flavors and slightly tangy.

Pours a nice dark straw color with good carbonation and a big white head.  Nose is bready yeast and wheat.  A little spice and citrus but not really strong.  Nice lemon and spice in the flavor followed by a nice mellow finish.
This is a good wit.  White in color.  Aroma has yeast, wheat, and coriander.  Flavor has more coriander and wheat, with some sugar.  A little citrus.

Pours pale golden with a small white head. Strong aroma of sweet tropical fruit, yeast, citrus, white pepper, and coriander. Flavor follows the aroma quite well with with a bit of lemon zest, and a smoky burnt pepper finish. Palate is medium and velvety smooth despite the almost sharp carbonation. Fairly well-balanced and super easy drinking.

Bottle. Moderate malt, hop and yeast aromas of grain, grass, musty and cobwebs, with white wine and clove in the background. Head is almost non existing, with no lacing and is fully diminishing. Flavor starts light to moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic. Palate is light to medium, watery and has a lively carbonation. Light and refreshing, a nice Belgian White.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2009 Dry wheat aroma, touch of lemon rind.  Hazy pale yellow, suspended sediment, moderate carbonation.  Dense with wheat, becomes a bit cottony on the palate.  Little notes of peach and apricot highlight the dry grain.  Newer bottle has more coriander and lemon in the aroma

Bottle from a mixed 6. Nose is standard Wit, but lots of spice and yeast in the flavor. Tart Saison-y bite to it on the finish, really enjoyable. I didnt look much @ the bottle, and had no idea it was 7%abv - well masked. I will go back for a 6 of this.

Draught. Poured turbid yellow with little to no head. Nose was wheat, citrus, spices, and slightly piney. Flavor was sweet orange, coriander, wheat crispness, lemon zest, and some hops. Palate was medium bodied, and had a little carbonated bite in the throat. Enjoyable even though I usually dont like wheat ales.
Dark yellow pour with white head.  Spice in the aroma, taste is typical of a wit with more carbonation and hops.

On tap at Falling Rock.  I need to change it up a bit after a couple of Blind Pigs had numbed my mouth.  This was a nice choice.  Lovely hazy yellow, big white head.  Great aroma - lots of spice, yeast, and even a touch of alcohol.  Taste is terrific - exactly as described, a full flavoured and kicked up Wit.  Really balanced well - spices, yeast, citrus, light carbonated body - all come together really well.  Dry finish.  Really good.

Bottle, 12 fl. oz. Pours an unclear yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is fresh, fruits and a little yeast. The flavor has coriander and orange, and leaves a fresh palate. Overall a nice refrshing belgian wit.

12 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy pale straw with a bright, frothy, white head. The nose is of coriander, dusty wheat and citrus blending together in harmony. Light-bodied and thin with a soft, wheaty mouthfeel and a fairly clean finish. The flavor is very nice: a satisfying blend of citrus (lemon and orange), coriander and soft wheat. A fan of witbiers, I now have a locally available, tasty and quaffable American wit that weighs in at an IPAs ABV. I am a happy camper, and I think I have found a new summer staple. Good stuff.

12oz bottle.   Pours a perfectly cloudy light yellow golden with a thin fine white fizzy froth.  Aroma is bready and floral, rose pedals, sweet.  Flavor is very floral with sweet sugary cereal and a coriander finish.  
Cereal aftertaste.  Medium bodied with a fuller mouthful yet still crisp, sticky syrupy feeling left after swallowing.  Similar to Sam Adams Imperial Wit in that its quite floral and a bit syrupy.

12oz bottle on May 2, 2009, thanks to William.  Pale honey color, almost yellow.  Well carbonated, clear. Aroma of citrus, yeast, spice.  Light, but almost creamy.  Coriander apparent.  Yeast is way obvious here... not my cup of tea, but for what it is, its drinkable and well balanced.

Bottle pours a slightly hazy golden orange color.  Foamy head that quickly dissapates with some lacing along the side of the glass.  Aroma of orange zest, spices, wheat, and yeast.  Sweet flavor with mixture of orange zest, yeast, coriander, and some maltiness.  Slightly dry finish.  Nice and refreshing.

bottle.  light haze to a golden/orange pour with thin head.  nice mellow aroma of orange, yeast and spice.  a bit sour and peppery.  dry in the very finish.  tartness is a bit suprising.  all other flavors subtle.  nice brew.

I love the brewery, but one of the most dissapointing double whites Ive had.  Very little aroma besides a bit of alcohol, frothy 1 inch head, quickly dissapating.  Lack-luster flavor...everything is there (spice, candy sugar, orange), but its too subtle for my tastes.
Pours a light orange with a thick white head - very little lacing.  Aroma of sour citrus , honey and spice.  Taste of orange, coriander and some clove.  Nice refreshing light beer.
I was pleasantly surprised by this one. Nice light aroma of fruit, spice, malt and yeast. Flavor has hints coriander, orange zest, lemon peel and malt. Good balance overall.

Cloudy straw hue with thin white head. Nose of fruit, spices, wheat with a touch of sulfur. Taste is spicy and fruity but fades fairly fast. A bit too thick for a white, not as drinkable as I would expect.  Hybrid style doesnt work too well here.
12 oz bottle.  Cloudy yellow-orange pour with a thick white head.  Aroma of orange peel, coriander and yeast.  Full taste with malt and spices present and a smooth lasting finish.
Crushed with Jakebra at Falling Rock. More hefe tendencies than wit it seems. Very yeasty and a bit sour. Surprised its rated so high. Its tasty but not incredible.

Reviewed 3/25/2009 (Bottle):

Pours a pale yellow semi-cloudy body, foamy creamy white head, good lacing, lasting.  Aroma is spicy orange zest. Coriander maybe. Enticing. Dusty, musty. Somewhat effervescent. Lemony citrus light carbonation taste. Tasty and refreshing.

Have had multiple times in bottles and draft. Lately on tap for happy hour. I feel this beer has changed over the past few years. More spice and sweetness now was more on the citrus side and more dry I feel. Pretty heavy on the spice, cloves and banana lately. Still pretty good.

on tap Ginger Man NYC
pours hazy gold with aroma of wheat, light spice and yeast.
Didnt get the orange slice out soon enough, slow server...
Strong citrus
Flavour was smooth wheat malt, good corriander spice tones lighter banana breadiness.

Bottle poured a hazy gold with a small diminishing white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, light coriander and light citrus. Palate was medium bodfied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, yeast, coriander and light citrus with a smooth yeasty finish. Yet another disappoiuntment from Southampton. After all the talk I expected better from this brewer.

Twelve ounce single bottle from Total Wine here in Jacksonville, Florida.  It is spring time, kiss the ring bitches.  The beer pours a nice light gold color with no head.  Aroma is all banana and a bit of coriander.  Taste is all yeast, bread and some sweetness.  A very nice beer.
finally have southampton available in the colorado market.  what is all the hype about with this wit?  only positive is the price/ABV%.
Decent belgian white.  Oranges and spice on the nose and palate, thick mouth feel.  Overall a drinkable wit.

Bottle.  Pours slightly hazy yellowish with a short lived white head.  Smell is atrocious with a ton of fake buttered popcorn like butter and just a hint of wheat and not much else.  Taste is better than the smell with a nice crisp wheatiness, a bit of citrus and spice as well.  Medium body and crisp carbonation, but there is a touch of butteriness to the flavor as well.  The smell really kills an otherwise decent beer here.

12 oz bottle:  Pours a golden yellow with a thin head and a surprising amount of carbonation.  Sweet yeast, orange, lemon, and spice aroma.  A very nice taste comprised of yeast, citrus, and mild spices.  Surprised by how much I liked this one.

This brew is a hazy golden-orange color with a thin and fizzy white head that recedes steadily, and some chunks on the bottom of the glass. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Citrus and spices in the nose. Light-bodied with orange peel, spice and yeast flavors. The finish is zesty fruit with a vanilla and yeast aftertaste. Not sure what makes this a "Double" as it seemed within the bounds of many Wits I have tried. Decent either way.
Bottle shared by Dogbrick.  Pours a chunky gold with a big white head.  Yeasty aroma with a sweet malt influence.  Yeast flavor with some citrus and a peppery finish.
Yellowish orange pour with a thin white head, very strong lemon and corriander, refreshing lemon and orange taste, well-hidden alcohol leaves a perfectly dry aftertaste.
Pours an orange, clear body with little to no head. Sweet, semi-fruity nose with a hint of coriander.

12oz bottle.  Pours semi cloudy golden straw color.  Aromas of citrus, orange and lemon peel, yeast, and some spice (coriander).   Flavors are sweet citrus up front, and some nice spicy yeast, and malt in the finish.  Decent stuff here, I was surprised to see it was almost 7%.

Pours a cloudy dirty straw color, dark gold, with a moderate white head.  Nice aroma of wheat, spice (coriander and orange of course), but a bit more of everything than usual.  Tangy taste of bitter spice, strong bread, sourdough, orange peel, and a bit of caramel even.  Balanced between the spice and malt, but not that sweet.  Finishes pretty clean with a buttered bread flavor.  Creamy and full for the style, easy enough to drink.  Nice!

12 oz. Bottle: Pours cloudy white yellow, a head of fine bubbles, aromas of wheat, malt sweetness and light pear fruit, faint citrus and coriander spice, some faint pepper in the nose, taste of malt-wheat, pilsner, citrus peach-pear, and pepper, small hops on the palate, and the pepper hangs around in the finish, the beer leaves a good lacing on the glass, medium dry on the palate, a tasty white beer

Poured a slightly hazy pale golden color with a dense white head that was slow to settle and produced good lacing.  The aroma was light yeast, citrus, pepper and wheat.  The flavor was a bit of citrus and wheat with some sweeter malt coming through.  Not much pepper or bite to this one.  Expected more from a double-wit.  Mouthfeel wasnt bad.  Carbonation wasnt too in your face.

Bottle, listed as Publick House.  Pours a dull, cloudy yellow with little head.  Aroma is hollow plastic woody lemon with a sour coriander presence.  Flavor is quickly-fading lemon coriander with a hint of cedar.  Average mouthfeel.  A boring beer that needs more pizazz.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Pours a hazy golden color, has a one finger head. smells mostly of the spices. sorta has a belgian golden ale smell about it. And the taste im picking up the most is banana, but also getting the clove taste, and a touch of orange. but doesnt taste like a belgian golden ale which i thought it smelled like. Its actually not a bad brew, i could drink a few of these no problem. has a clean finish and is more mellow then i expected from a "double white"

For this type of style - too much. Why do we want to push everything up.
Tried 2/13/09
Nose - Clove, spice and banana
Taste - very clovey and hints of pepper and watered down orange. 
Decent color but had a muddled element that didnt seem right.
Stay with a Hoegaarden if you want this style.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2009 Draft at Redlight. Hazy golden colored with a nice white head. Bananas and cloves dominate the flavor with some nice spices hitting mid palate and a finish that is mellow and a little light. I do like this one though. Would be an excellent choice on a nice warm Florida day.  Re-rate, bottle.  Hazy gold, thick white head that fades to a whispy layer.  Coriander, bubblegum, wheat and spice.  A little zing but also a touch thin.  Was better on draft but still a solid beer for the hot Florida days.

On tap at Bacchus.  Pours a hazy opaque amber with a small white head which falls off rather quickly.  Nose is bright citrus and yeast, with a bit of banana and clove.  Sweet lemon on a smooth finely carbonated body.  Clean light yeasty finish that zings the gums nicely.
Bright yellow orange in color and cloudy with a medium sized white head. Aroma is of citrus, peaches and a light tartness. Taste is slightly tart with peaches and orange peel.

Draught at RFD.   Hazy gold with a small white head.   Light aroma of some banana, orange, yeast, and grainy wheat.   The flavor is like a sweet banana and orange creamsicle.   Medium, creamy, almost fatty body.   Enjoyable, but almost seems like a weizenbock more than a wit because the banana is so prominent.

12oz. from Publix in Spring Hill, FL. Pours a nice honey color, thin white head. Medium lacing....lots of bubbling carbonation. Really great aroma...tons of fruits: grapes, grapefruit, orange. Alot of florals....A really sweet honey smell...Flavor is really nice; grapes, honey, yeast, a bit of sour citrus fruits. Starts medium bodied and finishes lighter. Weird mouthfeel...pretty smooth going down. This one really surprised me..."White" usually rases a red flag for me...but this one is really enjoyable. Great aroma, great flavor, great beer...Reminds me alot of DFH Midas Touch.
Bottle: pours golden amber with a thin white head, aroma of candy sugar, lemon, spices, taste is sweet, citrus, some spices, fairly thin mouthfeel.  Very refreshing brew.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a very hazy, bright orange body with a foamy, snow white, finger-width head that dissipates slowly and remains moderately laced. Aroma of bubblegum wheat. Some Belgian yeastiness, candy lemons and oranges, and a hint of coriander spices. Pretty solid aroma, but the flavor isnt as nice. Definitely more flavor than a typical white ale, but still relatively boring. Some wheat malts and coriander spicing throughout as well as a light citrus hop backing. Obvious Belgian yeastiness and a crispness throughout. Finishes quick with a light lingering sweet wheat flavor. Palate is medium to light with a tickling carbonated feel. Overall, I guess the white ale category isnt really my thing. This is nicer than most white ales out there, in fact the aroma was pretty nice, but its still kind of lame. Good balance and refreshing, just not my favorite style.
Taste 2/9 Bottle. Looks: Cloudy pale gold. Aroma: Some candy sweetness, lemon and orange. Taste: Sweet, thin bodied and a little silky and creamy. Spice and orange.

12oz bottle served in a Chimay chalice at the ambient room temp, which is probably in the high 50s to low 60s. Sharp wheat, herbal, and light citrus aroma. Slightly hazy, orange/golden color with a smallish head. Very smooth mouthfeel. Lots of sharp wheat in the flavor along with strong herbal flavors and some light lemon/tangerine. Alcohol is present. I seemed to like this better when fresh, this bottle is several months old.

orange peel and pineapple aromas ... some lacing ... damn easy to drink but not awfully complex, and for 6.8% very well masked ... "fanny bandits??" ... leaves a nice subtle aftertaste .. the next step after blue moon ...
Bottle.  Hazy, light yellow color.  White head.  Aroma is spicy, yeasty and full of wheat.  Flavor is creamy and has some nice wheat and yeast notes.  Nice beer.

The appearance is hazy golden yellow. The aroma is fairly strong, and I can easily smell the coriander. The flavor is definitely wheat, and I can also taste citrus as well. The palate isnt great in my opinion, but that doesnt keep this from being a great beer.
A nice Belgian style wheat.  Almost leans towards a strong ale.  Nice strength and balance of pitted and citrus fruits.  Coriander is very faint.
Draft at Flying Saucer. Strong green olive aroma.  Minimal spice in the flavor.  Weak carbonation.

12oz bottle from world of beers in tampa.  hazy light yellow pour with a thin white head.  aroma of spices, bready yeast, banana and lemon.  taste is less sweet than I would have guessed from the smells.  flavors of cloves and citrus.  crisp and creamy medium texture.  tasty overall - in a style that isnt my favorite.

Draught at Flannigans, Poured in pint glass with very small head. Aroma of thick wheat, orange and coriander. Very smooth to drink with a nice slight bite of alcohol at the end of each sip. Very well balanced, slightly stronger witbier.

355 ml bottle. Finland. AW09.
Hazy golden colour. 
Very fruity (apple and citrus) aroma. Witbier-like aroma. Flavour is not so witbier. Apple juice, cider and witbier all together. Very interesting but I like more traditional Belgian Wit.

bottle.  small white fizzy head into murky yellow body.  aromas of orange, corriander, and some banana (mild).  flavor is initially lightly bittersweet but finishes lightly sweet.  moderate finish duration.  average carbonation.  watery mouthfeel.  actually wits are starting to grow on me.
(Bottle, 0.355 l, at Pikkulintu, Helsinki, on 2009-01-22) Cloydy yellow. Fruity, spicy and cowhouse aromas. Small white head. Spicy, fruity and citric flavour.

In bottle, at Sadlacks in Raleigh.  Yellow, cloudy pour, with medium white head.  Aroma of banana, with citrus, coriander, and other spices.  Flavor is similar, with a strong yeastiness, and a nice tangy finish.  However, the strong banana flavor and aaroma suggests more of a double hefe that a double witte.

12oz in De Koninck glass.  Effervescent cloudy yellow.  Pours nearly syrupy.  Slightly muddled nose of apricots, dough, and nutmeg.  Flavor is largely akin to weissbier, which works for me.  Finishes with tingly carbonic bite and hints of white pepper.

This one pours hazy yellowish orange color with a small white head that settlers to a thin film. The aroma is of orange peel, coriander, wheat, and some citrus hops. THe flavor follows with a good amount of sweet oranges, coriander, wheat, and some candy sugar sweetness. Medium bodied and almost creamy with nice carbonation that goes down fairly smooth. Much fuller on the palate than most of this style. This is definitely an imperial belgian white. Good flavor in this one and nice and refreshing.

Comes out of the tap a bright honey yellow, cloudy to the point of opaqueness, with a little white head. Aroma is lemony and wheaty, inviting a taste. Well-rounded flavor is wheaty and pleasantly tart with a strong lemon overtone. Texture is bubbly and lively, and leaves a crisp and lemony aftertaste.

12 oz. bottle: Pours a hazy straw with a small head.Clear until I poured the remaining bottle yeast. Aroma is of cloves and fruit from the esthers. Medium body. Taste is crisp and spicy but not dry at all. Fairly complex, although it is a little two sweet for me. Not bad. Excellent with a nice light fish and salad.

12oz bottle served in a shaker pint. Poured a very hazy pale gold with a finger of white head. Lots of carbonation. Bottle conditioned. Tons of banana and a wheaty spice in the nose. More banana and fruit flavors. A little on the sweet side. It seemed a little flabby to me. Mouthfeel was nice though. I prefer clove over banana in a wit, so this didnt do a whole lot for me.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus, yeast, banana, lemon and notes of coriander. Flavor is sweet and yeasty with orange zest, banana, cloves and spices with a medium body and a clean and crisp finish.
Hazy golden of color with a white head. A fresh aroma of lemon, spice and sweets. A flavor of lemon, spice and a nice dry finish.

Thanks kiefdog for the share. Pours a hazy straw yellow with a nice white head. Nose of orange peel, coriander, and grassy citrus. Flavor is similar with a sugary lemon presence and some peppery characteristics in mid-swallow. Floral, pleasant, and refreshing. Reminiscent of Weyerbacher White. Good stuff.

12oz bottle from Beer World (Largo, FL). Pours a hazy bright yellow color with a one finger frothy white head that settles slowly and heavily laces the glass. Aroma is malty with notes of wheat, lemon, fresh custard, coriander, yeast and bread. Flavor is sweet and light with notes of honey, bread, yeast, lemon, other faint citrus flavors. Generally light body with a sweet and citrusy finish.

Belgian white with an intense aroma of sweet and tart: banana, apple and vanilla in the forefront- spice and floral hints. Very pleasant to drink with a creamy palate, Hazy gold color. This has just knocked Hoegaarden off as my favorite Belgian Witbier.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2008 12oz. bottle.  Intensely fruity aroma, spicy and citric, with notes of banana, lemon, orange, coriander, vanilla and clove, also showing honeysuckle sweetness and a mildly doughy yeast character.  Cloudy medium straw yellow color with a lasting, fine, uneven head.  Pretty nicely balanced flavor profile, with lightly malty sweetness up front, giving way to a gently citric bitterness and herbal hop tones, becoming spicier and tangy towards the finish, which dries out to a surprising extent by the end.  Finely carbonated, gently acidic and smooth palate, body is medium.  Incredibly easy to quaff.  Nice overall.

On draft at The Ravenous Pig, Orlando.  Pours a foggy gold color with a light lemony wheat scent.  Taste is bold with a slight bitter bite.  Lots of lemon and typical wheat notes.  Lots of flavor.  Good white.

Cloudy bright orange gold body with a large bright white head. The aroma has some rich oranges and light coriander spice. There is also some grassy character that is pleasing. The taste is strong with the orange peels and grass. There is a strong note of the coriander in the finish. The mouthfeel is creamy and thick. Good for the style.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2008 Lemony in color with a touch of cloudyness thrown into the mix.  Very smooth tasting, nice bitter citrus upfront, that finishes with a slightly sweet floral aftertaste.  Clean herbal aroma with a touch of citrus.  Overall, I think this is a pretty darn good brew.  I look forward to drinking more.

pours a hazy dark yellow with small bubbly head. Heavy carbonation. Aroma has wheat, yeast, citrus, and bubblegum, as well as light spices like maybe coriander. Flavor is more fruity, with banana and orange as well as more yeast. Palate is a tad bitter but holds well for a witbier. Solid brew overall.

Pours a cloud pale amber with a small white head. Smells of dried fruit and clove with coriander Flavor has lots of grain with some spices and dried fruit. Pretty tasty brew and nice complex feel. My only complaint would be that it has a bit of a strong alcohol finish to it. Aside from that its pretty solid. Worth a try.

cloudy dark gold color. scent is typical, yeast and lemon. taste is bready, citrusy with some spices in the back. finishes pretty quickly but some ripe fruit lingers. its better than some, but others are better than this.
Cloudy amber.  Aroma of wheat and spice.  Tastes spicy particularly clove.  Banana.  Not bad but there are better Belgian whites around.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Re-rate 5/18/12: Bottle sample at a Beer & Beyond strong beers tasting at Norma Jean. Wheaty, very spicy, with some citrus fruitiness. 6/3/6/3/13=3.1

(10/25/08) Draught sample at the brewpub in Southampton. Says 7.2% on the board. Cloudy pale yellow color. Aroma of wheat, citrus and some spicy notes. Sweet wheaty flavor with some orange, lemon notes and some coriander. A dry spicy finish with hints of alcohol. Medium-bodied. Nice. 7/3/7/3/14=3.4

Pours a nice solid yellow hue with a nice fluffy 2 finger head that slowly fades into a nice thin layer and a solid edge ring. Foams sticks slightly to the sides. Fairly lively carbonation and virtually no thickness to the liquid. Looks light. Wow that a really nice spiciness that comes from what I imagine is the huge amounts of actual spice. Mixed with coriander and orange zest and lemon zest. Some clove and a nice hint of alcohol. Taste or orange and lemon with a huge amount of coriander and spice that stick though the whole beer. Some definite clove and even a touch of honey. The lively carbonation gives the illusion of a fuller beer than this is. Still it’s a very flavorful beer whose intention are fulfilled in being absolutely delicious. This beer is not only great on a hot day, it’s also great with any spicy food. Chinese, BBQ, Thai and even Buffalo chicken. This is an all around winner in my book! This beer is quiet drinkable and should be enjoyed all summer long, with friends and great food. I don’t know what it is about this beer but I highly recommend it!

Pours a cloudy orange color with a thin white head that quickly disapates into nothing. There is some sediment that lingers in the beer.
Smells very floral and lots of yeast.
Taste fruity with a cinamin aftertaste. 
This is a very drinkable beer even though it is fruity.

Note. The bottle is different than the one pictured.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-22-2008
Cloudy orange/yellow pour with a large and frothy white head.  Nice banana and clove aroma.  Flavor is spicey with lemon, clove, banana and orange.  Very tasty with a bit of a boozy kick.  Nice!

Bottle, labeled 6.6 abv. (probably a dumb Texas rule). Golden, very cloudy, awesome, pour with a small white head lasting only a minute. medium intricate lacing. Aroma of banana, cliantro, and orange peel. Flavor is refreshing, with notes of lemon, orange, clove, and other garden spices. Texture is medium/thin and has a mildy sharp bite. Finish is tart and has the taste of banana.

Pours with a five finger, white head that fades quickly and leaves some lace. Pale, cloudy amber color, yeast left in bottom of bottle. Good carbonation and light-medium body. Spicy, yeasty nose. Flavor is a sweet yeasty orange/lemon. $1.53 for a 12oz bottle from Tully’s Beer and Wine Wells, Me
very cloudy gold under a large white fluffy head.  vanilla, spice, banana aroma.  lots of banana and vanilla in the flavor.  creamy palate.  really good.

12 oz. Bottle.  Has golden pale body, with a pure white head.  Nice and spicy smell to it.  Very tasty with an orange and lemon zest taste to it.  Very light, could drink on a hot day.  WELCOME BACK RATEBEER.COM

Pours golden clear, white head.
Aroma, spicy and yeasty.
Taste, very sweet and thick. Loaded with nice flavors. Light spices (coriander) and citrus / orange notes.
This is just one amazing wit bier, double the taste, and you get just a full bodied beer. A little stronger than the average wit bier, but this one is extremely drinkable and enjoyable.

12oz. bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow golden color with a small frothy white head that lasts awhile. The aroma is banana and spice. Good sticky lacing on the glass. The taste is a lemon zest and a very sweet finish. A very good Belgian White from Southampton.

12oz bottle.  Pours a pale, faded gold and turns into a muddy, creamy and cloudy goden color.  A nice white head with great lacing.  Smell is of spices and lemon.  Taste is of spices, lemon and orange rind.  Mouthfeel is medium and creamy.   Pretty good for a wheat beer.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is hazy pale golden. Aroma and taste are malt, citrus, straw and herbs. Light acidic.

12oz bottle. Pours opaque cloudy yellow/straw with medium white head. The aroma is like an herbal citrus tea: floral, lemongrass, touch of honey. The flavor has a mild residual sweetness that is delicate but notable and delicious. The flavor has lots of wheat and biscuit notes and a dry flour impression from flaked unmalted grains. There is an interesting floral quality to the ester profile. The finish is refreshing and somewhat sweet with a mild honey sweetness. Lemon zest and coriander are present throughout at medium intensity. The floral and sweet qualities are somewhat reminiscent of Unibroue’s Blanc de Chamblee (just somewhat). The mouthfeel is creamy with a full body. There are lots of suds but the crisp bubbles aren’t too much and don’t provide sting to the tongue - just right. Overall, this is a beautiful witbier. The strength is great enough for the beer to be obviously a double - but it provides enough extra punch to be more flavorful and delectable than most typical-strength witbiers.
Not a fan of this style but this is yummy and hits the spot.  Not much lingers and a lot agrees.  Thumbs up.

This is a good wit.  12 oz bottle poors to hazy yellow body.  Aroma is nice and of citrus.  Taste is also citrus and smooth.  Of the wits Ive sampled, would but put this one only behind St. Bernardus.
The aroma is citrusy, with wheat, coriander, and yeast. The appearance hazy gold with a nice head. The flavor is like the aroma with a green tea like finish. The palate is thin. Overall I like it.
a full effect of what a Belgian beer should be, thick full malts with lots of coriander and orange. Strong Alcohol, body and style
Can’t taste anything other than the basic characteristics of white ales.  This was number 25 on my beerfest quest.

(Bottle from 1828 Vintage House) Pours fairly cloudy golden with only a very small off-white head. Lack of head is quite surprising esp. since beer was decanted into a weizen. Body is also clearer than I would have expected. Hmmm. Inviting aroma of citrus, spice, bread and yeast. Mouthfeel is wheaty smooth with a decent amount of heft for the style. Flavor of citrus, spice and bread with a bit of a wheaty, boozy quality like in a weizen bock only in a lighter, more refreshing style. Maybe a touch of pepper in the finish and aftertaste. Kind of nice!
Poured a cloudy light yellow with a small white head that did leave a little bit of a lacing.  It was very easy to drink and was wheaty with a little light spices.  You could taste the yeast.

Light pale with white head that left some lacing.  Aroma was grassy/musty and slightly fruity.  Citrus and spicy flavor, clean and little hop profile.  A nice easy drinking and flavorful summertime brew, with a bit more kick as a double.

Cloudy, tan-olive colored pour that leaves lace on the glass.  Pungent, citrusy aroma with strong floral and malt tones.  This is quite robust for a witbier.  The Belgian yeast flavor comes thru clearly, and other flavors are noticable too - orange, snappy hops, and a little coriander.  More malty-yeasty than gently sweet, this is a spicey wheat ale that you could sip while watching autumn raindrops fall.  This is my first rating of a Southampton Publick House brew, and you can color me impressed.

On tap and from a growler at Ginger Man in New York

Southampton Double White Ale is a cloudy, bleached-pale yellow color with an airy white colored head. The aroma has a complex wheat base, a touch of alcohol and a lot of citrus and lemon. The flavor is as complex as the aroma and has a great finish. This is a great strong Belgian White.

slightly cloudy, straw color, nose is coriander, dough, and some orange, flavor is ssome citrus, again some yeast, other belgian spices but very smooth and well balanced, quafable,
Very Nice

Draught into tulip. Pours cloudy pale yellow, with a foamy white head that fades quickly and leaves no real lacing. Aroma is heavy on sweet lemon zest, with a bit of spicy yeast and coriander in there as well. Taste is sweet and crisp up front - wheat blends with lemon citrus, with the spicy yeast coming in right before a sweet, zesty, clean finish. Very drinkable, full flavored, with a slightly heavier body then many wits I’ve tried. Medium body, crisp carbonation, only a hint of dryness on the finish.
Cloudy yellow appearance. Taste is sour with lemons, bananas, and grapefruit. This is a good representation of a Belgian white.  The spiciness is a little too overwhelming.

Bottle. Wheaty, lemon-citrus aroma. Moderate foamy head. Flavor....I don’t know. I guess since it’s called a "double white" I expected it to be stronger. It’s not at all. It tastes about the same as your average wit, with a little bit more alcohol flavor. Not bad at all, but alas, it didn’t meet my expectations.

On draft @ Monster B’s. Very fizzy pour with a thin bubble sip. Tones of orange, coriander and a bit of honey. Very light despite the ABV. My only big complaint is that it gave me a wicked case of acid reflux later on that night.

Pours a hazy golden orange color with tons of sediment floating around.  The head is about 1 finger thick and off-white.  No lacing.  Nose is lemon, bubblegum, honey, and yeast.  The flavor didn’t pack as much punch as I thought it would, but it is very pleasing.  Up front is more of the spicy yeast flavor, but it isn’t too bitey... it maintains a pretty smooth character.  As that fades, there is some citrus and malty notes that linger on the tongue as the alcohol comes out.  Leaves a slight bitterness in the mouth.  A very creamy texture.
12oz. bottle, lemon aroma, cloudy gold color, white head. I thought the lemon was a bit strong, but with the higher level of carbonation it worked well. Nice summer brew.

Aroma is full of yeast esters, honey, lemon zest, and floral aromas.  It’s appearance is a  slightly pale cloudy color, with a nice full head.  It’s flavor is excellent with nice full pale malts, honey, light citrus, and some yeasty notes.  It’s exceptionally smooth, with a bit of hmmm!!!!  The power is nice creating a nice dull delivery.  It’s excellent.

12oz bottle.  Lemony zest, spicy, floral aroma.  Taste is very spicy and citrusy, and excellent at first.  I found that the more I drank, the less I enjoyed it, as the lemon spiciness overpowered the beer.

12 oz bottle at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Hazy yellow color with yeast flocs and vanishing head. Spicy, perfumed, acidic, corky and appley aroma with notes of rhubarb. Dry, woody, corky, peppery and clovey flavor with coriander, strawberry and rhubarb. Dry sherry like finish. A great beer reminding dry saisons or fino sherry.
(Bottle).  Strong sour citrus aroma.  Hazy yellow with very small head.  Flavor is sourish fruit and spice, with a sour finish.

12 oz bottle....color of body resembles a lighter version of lemon meringue pie filling...sports a fluffy off-white head resembling the fluff of the pie---aromas lemon,  orange, some clove and spices, they all work together toward nasal wheat pleasure...body is light and creamy--zingy citrus (orange)-- nuances of wheat and clove also blended in this creation, yum, thanks Kawabomber---pretty queen annes lace lacing, not much of it but pretty none the less

Bottle. Hazy golden with suspended wheat and basically no head. Smell is a strong tangy-sour with sharp ciitrus, wheat, and some other rather indistinct vegetation. Taste to match. Too sticky on the lips.
Hazy unfiltered amber pour.  Smells of vanilla with hints of orange.  Almost sour at times.  The flavor is spicy and has the general wheat characteristics.  Smooth finish with a small bite.

I think i might have gotten an infected bottle, but here goes. Poured a cloudy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma was very sour smelling with some spice notes. Flavor was also very sour but not a citrus kind, a weird funky sour ale kind that shouldn’t be involved in this type of beer.
From a bottle, pours a murky yellow color. Aroma of citrusy lemon,  and spicey notes.  Similiar notes in the taste with hints of lemon and wheat.

4 oz. pour, on tap at the brewpub. Consumed on 7-31-08. Pleasant appearance: Effervescent pale yellow with white head. Very good lacing. Sweet aroma features bubblegum, whipped cream, and candy sugar scents. Tastes just as it smells, plus a lemon flavor. Delicious! A touch of dryness in the finish. Smooth and frothy in the palate. Medium body, but lighter than I expected. Southampton Double White Ale is a superb beer overall.

bottle. nice spicy wit yeast aroma. palate is light and somewhat fizzy. coriander is apparent in flavor. also has a light tart edge. little funky mustiness too. quite good. if the carbonation was a little more refined it would be excellent.

Very tasty inclusion from my secret santa this summer. Spicy aroma with some clove, coriander and yeast.  Flavor is full bodied and full of orange citrus. A bit of spice in the flavor as well. The finish is sticky sweet and a slight tinge of alcohol to finish it all off.
Cloudy yellow with a moderate white head. Lot’s of spice and citrus aroma’s. A dry crisp taste with the spice and citrus in the front. Another great beer for summer.
Hazy yellow colour with large white head.Aroma of citrus and spices feels really bitter with flavor of lemon and wheat.Light sour finish.
En gingerman con roberto y es una de las cervecerias mas famosas de la usa. Fue despues de subir el empire state con rogelio para q conociera

12oz bottle. Clear yellow in color. Two finger head. Aroma of spices orange and lemon. Taste is spicier then most witbiers. A little sourness to it. Dry aftertaste of orange. Easy to drink, not over carbonated. Good witbier!
bottle, lemonade color with slightest filmy head that leaves just a ring, nose is very lemon and clove, flavor is same lemon and cloves also some oranges very nice beer
On Tap at the Belgian Room. Pours a dark straw gold with a thick white head. Wheat lemon, coriander aroma. Very smooth wheaty taste with a hint of lemon. Nice dry finish, tasty on a hot day in NYC.

From Skjold Burne, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 050708.
Golden with white head. Aroma of citrus and wheat. Flavor dominated of coriander with malty, wheat and orange notes. Neither a heavy nor a refresher.

Aroma was very strong wheat/grains, some citrus, grass.  Appearance is attractive, a straw colored, hazy beverage, with a tinge of orange.  Persistent off white head, a lot of carbonation.  Flavor was wheat, citrus hops, a little bit of spice.  The palate was a little sour, with a hop crispness. Nice beer overall.

Bottle. Pours gold with a white head. Aroma is spicy, with clove, nutmeg, and lemon. Medium body. Flavot has a very nice balance of fruit and spice. Clove, nutmeg, lemon, banana. A very impressive wit.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with foamy egg white head. Aromas of lemon, coriander and yeast. Flavour of citrus, spice and some honey. Lovely refreshing on a hot summer day i Odense.

Appearance: Pours a lightly hazy, straw-colored body with a full, foamy, white head.

Smell: Aroma of coriander and dried orange peel with a vague underlying maltiness.

Taste: Delicate pale maltiness with a restrained honey-like sweetness. Strong spice component tasting of coriander, citrus peel, and white pepper. Low hop bitterness. Blip of acidity. Slightly sweet, slighty sour on the relatively crisp finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: I still feel the whole trend of doubling or imperializing witbiers is entirely lost on me, they dont get twice as refreshing, quite the opposite, in fact.
cloudy pale pour lots of spiceyness with a nice yeast aroma malty and coriander orange yummy

12oz Bottle thanks to kmweaver, thanks Ken!  I like witbiers so I wanted to try an east coast higly rated beer. This one was great. Perfect for the hot chicago summer. Wish this one could be available here. Poured a cloudy yellow haze, some fluffy head. Smells of spices, citrus and malts. Taste is soothing and refreshing. Leaving lots of aftertaste of pure goodness.

Bottle thanks to beerbill  Pours a cloudy yellow color with little to no head.  Smells spicy, with a few esters poking through.  Flavour is very citrusy, with some spice in the middle, and a little bit of alcohol warmth, but not too much.  Theres another flavour in there that might be the corriander, its kind of salt and pepper-ish, but Im really not sure.  Theres not a whole lot of hops, either flavour or bitterness.  Carbonation is pretty high, but not offensive, and mouthfeel is nice, not too watery, but not too thick either.  Pretty refreshing.

A- Pours a cloudy yellow color with a nice, frothy, white head.

S- Smell is spicy, perfumey, citrus fruits, a bit of tartness / funk towards the end and a lemonadesque sweetness.

T- Taste is very full, a blast of citrus fruits, spices, lemon with a tangy back end.

M- Thick for the style with ample carbonation. Maybe a bit to thick and sticky.

D- I havent had many witbiers but this is definitely the best I have consumed. Very drinkable, no off tastes. Quaffable for a summer evening.

Columbia, SC - Total Wines - 12 oz bottle. Murky, translucent light golden with a thin white head. Banana in the aroma with hints of bubble gum Flavor is on the sour side  in a good way - with some strong lemony accents. Yeasty notes, coriander, hints of bubble gum. Spritzy mouthfeel which sits just right.
Bottle. Aroma of coriander, orange peel, orange/citrus esters. Flavor similar, just a little less big and luscious. Exquisitely gulpable and refreshing. Very nice.

Bottle.  Pours a light gold with a nice white head that leaves pretty lacing on the glass.  Aroma of spices, orange peel, anise, and Belgian yeast.  Flavor of lots of spices, wheat, banana.  Very refreshing and smooth.  Good beer, very light for a "double strength" version.
Orange juice color nice light white head.  Smells of corrinador, oranges, orange peel, other citrus and fruits.  Taste is about the same as the smell.  Good beer.

4/4/08 notes:  bottle.  Pours a clear golden lemon color that is cloudy without being unfiltered. When poured, this beer featured a one-finger head.  Smell is of grass, orange, coriander and yeasty cotton candy, if that makes any sense.  Body is light and soft, featuring a small pearl carbonation that rolls the flavors into a nice little package.  I tasted citrusy orange and lemon, along with coriander and sugar.  Finish is sweet, and the alcohol is well-masked. Perhaps not quite as interesting as DDCs Premiere Neige, but overall, a very solidly crafted beer from Southampton that should stand out amongst Belgian Whites.
12 oz. bottle.  Hazy yellow, large foamy head leaves nice lacing.  A really tasty wit, very enjoyable and refreshing.

(on bottle) Hazy yellow, big head, lots of coriander and wheat in aroma. I find the taste and especially the finish very troublesom. I imagine the use of US hops to be too much for this type of beer, since the zingyness falls over and becomes very tart and acidic. The freshness from the first sips, becomes burning and metallic.

Bottle. Hazy medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, citrus - orange shell, moderate yeasty, moderate to light heavy coriander. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium to light, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. (180408)

Bottled. Hazy yellowish colour, mediumsized white lacing head. Aroma is yeast, wheat, sourness as well as spices. Flavour is spices, wheat, yeast and flowery hops. For being US-made witbier, its a very good one.

Poured from bottle 5/2008.  Aroma of spiced bread - nice.  Cloudy white gold, lacing head.  Bread, pepper, spice, banana in flavor.  This is really well done.  I noticed the coriander about midway through.  Finished great.  This actually ranks with the Belgian Witbiers.  Well done.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text:
355ml bottle ,Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Bitter and Sour 2008, shared with Fatphil & JK54B 150508
Color: hazy yellow, nice lace
Scent. bit phenols citrus
Taste:bit phenols, citrus, coriander.The nicest American white beer this year.

Pours a cloudy and hazy yellow from the bottle. Has a great aroma for a white beer. It smells floral and citrus and wheaty all at once. Pours with a  nice head that sticks around. Has a heavy citrus flavor as well and is well balanced for a white. A very smooth and refreshing beer. Up there as far as Whites go for me.

355ml Bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki)- Hazy golden in colour. Fresh and floral aroma with leomn and a bit of spice. Tangy taste with some hops,spice and lemon. Quite fizzy on the tongue. Nice and refreshing but needs a bit more body.

(Bottled) Hazy golden with a small head. Witbier-saisony aroma with some sourness and honeyish pale malt. Flavor is something between Plevnan Panimosima, and Weihenstephaner Vitus. Honeyish malt, witbier spices, raisins. Medium-bodied, soft-carbonated. Funny, but quite enjoyable. Lacks complexity, though.

On tap at Capones.  Pour was murky yellow-orange with a dense white  head .  Thick lace.  Strong coriander and citrus aroma.  Tastes like orange and cilantro.  A bit peppery and wheaty.  Medium/full body.  Average carbonation.  Dry, slightly tart finish.

355ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Bitter and Sour 2008)
Ghastly incipid hazy creamed corn colour, flecked with particles more than actual haze. Healthy head. Spicy coriander and wheaty aroma - quite authentic Belgian wit. Zesty lemon taste. Some floury dough, but also an interesting hoppy and alcoholic punch. A bit sour too.
UPDATED: MAY 26, 2008 Cloudy, hay colour. Nice white head. Lots of lemon. Not too sour. Very nice and smooth beer. 0.355l bottle.

12oz Bottle: Cloudy golden w/ a large white head & nice tight lacing. Also some sediment lurking in the bottom of the glass. Aroma is of wheat, yeast, citrus & coriander. Flavor starts off slightly sour w/ orange peel kicking in big time then some lemon & a bit of coriander to finish it off. Finish is mildly dry & mouthfeel is creamy & smooth.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2008 Pours like a pils, was brilliantly clear, one finger stark-white head that collapses. Looked in the bottle to see the yeast sediment was firmly compacted on the bottom. Smells yeasty, lemony and sour. The taste is so much bigger than you would assume, great lactic-like(?) sourness, underlying hop bitters and good coriander/curacao spiciness. The first sip hit me like a ton of bricks, I wasnt expecting that. It really is a double white - very skillfully brewed and downright delicious. Only downside is the collasping head, needs to be more proteiny and linger awhile. Do try it.
Heavy yeast aroma when first poured producing a thick white pillow of foam on top. Standard witbier flavor and easy drinking.
strong wheat scent with hints of of citrus. flavor follows. Actually, while beer is drinkable, its kind of uninspiring.
Cloudy golden with huge white head. Sweet wheaty and fruity aroma with yeast and coriander notes. Sweet wheaty flavor with yeast, orange peel and coriander notes. Ends sweet.

Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow with a thin white head. Slight sour aroma with citrus and clove. The flavor finds spices (mainly clove), fruits, and citrus (orange and lemon). Tangy feeling, slightly sour. Medium body (Rating from June 07)

Southampton Double White Ale
ABV: 6.8%
Calories: estimated at 150 C
Volume: 12 fl oz
Glass: weizen
Purchased at: Circle Liquors Super Saver
Price: $2.00
Consumed at: home

note: this tasting was brewed by Saratoga, which is apparently a crap version. 

Impression: Hazy wheaty banana infused fruitbeer. Belgian style aroma. Bumpy, rocky head with good haze and mystic golden color. After a series of IPAs tonight, theres little chance of a rich flavor to this beer, but regardless it seems a bit watery. Id pass on this next time, as a hoegaarden is more readily available and just as good. Texture is limp. Somewhat weak.

Aroma: 7 out of 10

Visuals: 3 out of 5

Taste: 6 out of 10

Palate: 3 out of 5

Overall: 12 out of 20

Wow, this was a disappointment.  Very hazy yellow body, little head, and no lacing forms.  Yesty, bubblegum aroma with banana, fruit, and light citrus.  Bubblegum, weak malt flavor, a spicy finish, but incredibly lacking in anything noteworthy.  Full body, lively carbonation on the tongue, but lacking, and becoming less and less enjoyable the more I suffer through.

12 oz bottle, courtesy of my sis and bro-in-law - pours a cloudy creamed honey colour with lots and lots of protein haze under a rocky white head.  Orange dominates in the aroma and underneath that is a surprising amount of hops.  The coriander is very faint under these two layers, and it mingles nicely with the spiciness of the hops.  Good quality grain in the nose as well.  Lemony and orange flavours are the main ones that are present, and there is also a candy sweetness from the yeast.  Sort of like red licorice.  Nice fresh, lively finish.  Alcohol well-integrated.  Wonderful wit.

Bottle.

Pours a cloudy light-straw color, a bit of floating matter, with an attractive fluffy white head. Interesting aroma: slightly sour, lemon; grassy, some alcohol, lots of orange peel and coriander. The flavor kicks in hard: its got a powerful puckering dryness that comes on with a syrup-like intensity, big orange-peel flavor, much more bitter than other examples of the style, again that alcohol making itself known, lemon, coriander notable mostly late, with banana juice coming on strong at the same time. 

Certainly an interesting beer and one that Im very pleased to have tried. But for me it just doesnt quite come together; its not light and refreshing enough for a Wit, the syrupy start and the strong banana close interfere with the powerful bitterness. Interesting...

UPDATED: APR 21, 2008 12 fl. oz. bottle, shared with neighbour Kjetil. Hazy yellow color, nice white head. Aroma is orange, yeast and wheat. Flavor is the same, with sourness and fruit. Complex and splendid wit-beer.

Draft.  Before me sat a a perfectly poured pint of witbier, orangish in color with a perfectly white head to cap it off. The aroma is so pungent of orange and spice that it wafted up for me to smell with out picking the glass up.  The body on this beer is decieving.  It is very light, yet delivers a hefty punch.  There is a strong hit of orange and spice to the flavor, yet balanced nicely with a malty sweetness to cover the higher ABV.  Quite good.
